meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the production of offspring while still in the larval stage.
meanings.sent1: The paedogenic insects lay eggs that hatch into larvae.
meanings.sent2: The paedogenic frogs reproduce before fully developing into adults.
meanings.sent3: The paedogenic tadpoles were already parents before becoming frogs.
meanings.sent4: The paedogenic butterflies start families as caterpillars.
meanings.sent5: The paedogenic nature of certain species is truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: Producing offspring while still in the larval stage.
meanings.sent1: The paedogenic fish give birth to young ones in their larval form.
meanings.sent2: The paedogenic salamanders have a unique way of reproducing.
meanings.sent3: It's quite a sight to see paedogenic creatures becoming parents so early.
meanings.sent4: The paedogenic birds bring forth new life in their juvenile state.
meanings.sent5: The concept of paedogenic reproduction is intriguing and unusual.
